Philippians__02.1: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of charity, if any society of the spirit, if any bowels of commiseration:
Philippians__02.2: Fulfill ye my joy, that you may be of one mind, having the same charity, being of one accord, agreeing in sentiment.
Philippians__02.3: Let nothing be done through contention, neither by vain glory: but in humility, let each esteem others better than themselves:
Philippians__02.4: Each one not considering the things that are his own, but those that are other men's.
Philippians__02.5: For let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:
Philippians__02.6: Who being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:
Philippians__02.7: But <u>emptied himself</u>, taking the form of a servant, being made in the likeness of men, and in habit found as a man.
Philippians__02.8: He humbled himself, becoming obedient unto death, even to the death of the cross.
Philippians__02.9: For which cause God also hath exalted him, and hath given him a name which is above all names:
Philippians__02.10: That in the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of those that are in heaven, on earth, and under the earth:
Philippians__02.11: And that every tongue should confess that the Lord Jesus Christ is in the glory of God the Father.
Philippians__02.12: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, (as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but much more now in my absence,) <u>with fear</u> and trembling work out your salvation.
Philippians__02.13: For it is God who worketh in you, both to will and to accomplish, according to his good will.
Philippians__02.14: And do ye all things without murmurings and hesitations;
Philippians__02.15: That you may be blameless, and sincere children of God, without reproof, in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation; among whom you shine as lights in the world.
Philippians__02.16: Holding forth the word of life to my glory in the day of Christ, because I have not run in vain, nor laboured in vain.
Philippians__02.17: Yea, and if I be made a victim upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice, and congratulate with you all.
Philippians__02.18: And for the selfsame thing do you also rejoice, and congratulate with me.
Philippians__02.19: And I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy unto you shortly, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know the things concerning you.
Philippians__02.20: For I have no man so of the same mind, who with sincere affection is solicitous for you.
Philippians__02.21: For all seek the things that are their own; not the things that are Jesus Christ's.
Philippians__02.22: Now know ye the proof of him, that as a son with the father, so hath he served with me in the gospel.
Philippians__02.23: Him therefore I hope to send unto you immediately, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.
Philippians__02.24: And I trust in the Lord, that I myself also shall come to you shortly.
Philippians__02.25: But I have thought it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother and fellow labourer, and fellow soldier, but your apostle, and he that hath ministered to my wants.
Philippians__02.26: For indeed he longed after you all: and was sad, for that you had heard that he was sick.
Philippians__02.27: For indeed he was sick, nigh unto death; but God had mercy on him; and not only on him, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
Philippians__02.28: Therefore I sent him the more speedily: that seeing him again, you may rejoice, and I may be without sorrow.
Philippians__02.29: Receive him therefore with all joy in the Lord; and treat with honour such as he is.
Philippians__02.30: Because for the work of Christ he came to the point of death: delivering his life, that he might fulfill that which on your part was wanting towards my service.
